text:
I read in the book "The Gluten Connection" that these oats are tested and are gluten free, and also no chance of cross-contamination, because they are from Europe who is WAY WAY WAY!!!!! ahead of the game as far as GF foods and testing for specific levels of gluten are concerned. This one came up safe.
I checked with my doctor/specialist and she had heard the same thing.
I also heard on Oprah that this is all she'll eat, so I tried them. Once you get used to it, you'll never go back to that bowl of slime.

PS: Whole grains are SUPPOSED to take longer to cook because they aren't broken down. So try it!
